body:
### Problem

UBSAN reports signed integer overflow in `charsize_regular` (via `plines_m_win` and friends) when displaying a completion info popup with `&showbreak` set and with a small number of `&columns`.

~~Though my repro relies on completion, the call to `plines_m_win` in `pum_adjust_info_position` looks pretty innocent to me... I suspect the issue is specifically with the plines stuff?~~
Nvm, as zeer points out it looks like `pum_adjust_info_position` is setting `w_view_width` to -1.

(I also did manage to hit a `glyph_cache` assert while trying to find a repro for this, but couldn't reproduce that one...)

```
neovim/src/nvim/plines.c:267:36: runtime error: signed integer overflow: 2147483647 + 1 cannot be represented in type 'int'
    #0 0x0000014321ed in charsize_regular neovim/src/nvim/plines.c:267:36
    #1 0x00000142dda2 in linesize_regular neovim/src/nvim/plines.c:447:13
    #2 0x00000143a3b4 in plines_win_nofold neovim/src/nvim/plines.c:798:11
    #3 0x000001439e21 in plines_win_nofill neovim/src/nvim/plines.c:776:21
    #4 0x00000143cd45 in plines_win_full neovim/src/nvim/plines.c:906:24
    #5 0x00000143cf7d in plines_m_win neovim/src/nvim/plines.c:925:14
    #6 0x00000145310d in pum_adjust_info_position neovim/src/nvim/popupmenu.c:986:25
    #7 0x000001447709 in pum_set_selected neovim/src/nvim/popupmenu.c:1197:13
    #8 0x000001442049 in pum_display neovim/src/nvim/popupmenu.c:428:12
    #9 0x000000eec65b in ins_compl_show_pum neovim/src/nvim/insexpand.c:1718:3
    #10 0x000000f06832 in show_pum neovim/src/nvim/insexpand.c:6286:3
    #11 0x000000efa53f in set_completion neovim/src/nvim/insexpand.c:3424:5
    #12 0x000000ef995b in f_complete neovim/src/nvim/insexpand.c:3450:7
    #13 0x000000a809d5 in call_internal_func neovim/src/nvim/eval/funcs.c:281:3
    #14 0x000000b592c0 in call_func neovim/src/nvim/eval/userfunc.c:1785:15
    #15 0x000000b56311 in get_func_tv neovim/src/nvim/eval/userfunc.c:580:11
    #16 0x000000b88a34 in ex_call_inner neovim/src/nvim/eval/userfunc.c:3352:9
    #17 0x000000b86fd7 in ex_call neovim/src/nvim/eval/userfunc.c:3594:14
    #18 0x000000c712a6 in execute_cmd0 neovim/src/nvim/ex_docmd.c:1759:7
    #19 0x000000c52e56 in do_one_cmd neovim/src/nvim/ex_docmd.c:2389:7
    #20 0x000000c47b77 in do_cmdline neovim/src/nvim/ex_docmd.c:679:20
    #21 0x000000701677 in apply_autocmds_group neovim/src/nvim/autocmd.c:1940:5
    #22 0x00000070ada1 in apply_autocmds neovim/src/nvim/autocmd.c:1573:10
    #23 0x0000017e79ac in may_trigger_modechanged neovim/src/nvim/state.c:276:3
    #24 0x000000958743 in insert_enter neovim/src/nvim/edit.c:263:3
    #25 0x00000094f91f in edit neovim/src/nvim/edit.c:1374:3
    #26 0x0000012f9720 in normal_finish_command neovim/src/nvim/normal.c:1065:7
    #27 0x000001296b6d in normal_execute neovim/src/nvim/normal.c:1257:3
    #28 0x0000017e42fc in state_enter neovim/src/nvim/state.c:100:26
    #29 0x000001278565 in normal_enter neovim/src/nvim/normal.c:523:3
    #30 0x000000fe0181 in main neovim/src/nvim/main.c:660:3
    #31 0x7f67f918c5b4 in __libc_start_call_main (/lib64/libc.so.6+0x35b4) (BuildId: f410d74336e800b1795d2fd97ddfd36c16ad6546)
    #32 0x7f67f918c667 in __libc_start_main@GLIBC_2.2.5 (/lib64/libc.so.6+0x3667) (BuildId: f410d74336e800b1795d2fd97ddfd36c16ad6546)
    #33 0x0000004017f4 in _start (neovim/build/bin/nvim+0x4017f4) (BuildId: 2f1ca933ccc1846e6509344f1d0836c943eb8d86)

SUMMARY: UndefinedBehaviorSanitizer: undefined-behavior neovim/src/nvim/plines.c:267:36
```

### Steps to reproduce

```vim
set columns=12 showbreak=e completeopt+=popup
startinsert
autocmd ModeChanged *:i ++once call complete(col('.'),
      \ [#{word: 'foo', info: 'a'->repeat(99)},
      \  #{word: 'bar', info: 'a'->repeat(99)}])
```

### Expected behavior

No signed overflow.

### Nvim version (nvim -v)

NVIM v0.12.0-dev-1898+g5a1a92cc7a

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

no, VIM 9.1.2017

### Operating system/version

Fedora 43 Workstation

### Terminal name/version

ghostty 1.2.3, tmux 3.5a

### $TERM environment variable

tmux-256color

### Installation

Source

(`size - prev_rem == INT_MAX` just before the overflow)

267             int cnt = (size - prev_rem + width - 1) / width;
(gdb) bt

Ah, you're right. Looks like things are negative in `pum_adjust_info_position`:

```
border_width = 0
col = 13
right_extra = -1
left_extra = -2
count = 1
```

labels.description: issue reporting a crash or segfault
labels.name: bug-crash

title: Signed overflow during completion with small `columns`, `completeopt+=popup` and `showbreak` set
